intro: Drabella columnae, commonly known as the columnar draba, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Drabella columnae has a compact, columnar growth habit, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers, which are usually white or pale yellow, bloom in early spring and attract pollinators such as bees.
